Highlander II: Renegade Version (1991)
Tagline: It\\\\\\\&#039;s a kind of magic

 Connor Macleod and Juan Sanchez Villa-Lobos Ramirez return in this all
 action sequel to 1985\\\\\\\&#039;s Highlander. The year is 2024, and MacLeod is
 now a mortal old man. However the world has become a very dead planet
 since the creation of \\\\\\\"the shield\\\\\\\", an artifical ozone layer - which
 MacLeod supervised construction of. It turns out that MacLeod was
 banished from a distant past with his mentor Ramirez. MacLeod\\\\\\\&#039;s old
 nemesis from the past (General Katana) travels into the future to kill
 Connor once an for all. MacLeod calls upon the spirit of Ramirez to
 help him defeat Katana, before Katana kills him. MacLeod is also aided
 by Louise Marcus, an environmental activist that believes the ozone
 layer as repaired itself and \\\\\\\"the shield\\\\\\\" is no longer necessary.

Christopher Lambert, Virginia Madsen, Michael Ironside, Sean Connery

3.4/10 IMDB Rating http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0102034/

Digitally Remastered and re-edited film with over 19 minutes of footage.
Running Audio Commentary by Director Russell Mulcahy and Producers Bill
Panzer and Peter Davis
English Captioning and Spanish Subtitle options
Behind-the-scenes photos, production sketches and publicity stills
Highlander 2: To be or not to be...a sequel? A new documentary created
especially for this release with new interviews with actors and the producers
about the need for a renegade version of Highlander 2.

Prepare to experience a totally new incarnation of one of the most spectacular
cinematic adventures..in the Director\\\\\\\&#039;s cut, Highlander 2: Renegade version.
This is the re-edited, completely restored saga of the continuing exploits
of immortal Connor MacLeod (Lambert) and his swashbuckling mentor Juan Sanchez
Villa-Lobos Ramirez (Connery). Whether you\\\\\\\&#039;re a die-hard Highlander fan, or a
newcomer to the incredible universe of the immortals, prepare to discover what
millions have discovered before you, \\\\\\\"There can be only one\\\\\\\"
